info.name: 02 - Authentication/Authorization
info.description:
# 02 - Authentication/Authorization

## Overview

This collection demonstrates comprehensive authentication and authorization testing using the Restful-Booker API. It showcases token-based authentication, secure request handling, and complete CRUD operations on protected endpoints with proper credential management.

## API Used

- **Base URL**: [https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com](https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com)
    
- **Documentation**: [https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com/apidoc/index.html](https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com/apidoc/index.html)
    
- **Authentication Type**: Token-based (Cookie)
    

## Features Demonstrated

- ‚úÖ Token generation and management
    
- ‚úÖ Authentication validation (success and failure scenarios)
    
- ‚úÖ Secure header implementation (Cookie-based auth)
    
- ‚úÖ Protected endpoint testing
    
- ‚úÖ Dynamic date generation for bookings
    
- ‚úÖ Complete booking lifecycle management
    
- ‚úÖ Negative testing (invalid credentials, deleted resources)
    
- ‚úÖ Date calculations and formatting
    
- ‚úÖ Token masking for security logging
    

## Collection Contents

### 1\. Create Token

- Authenticates with valid credentials
    
- Generates authentication token
    
- Validates token format (hexadecimal)
    
- Stores token securely in collection variables
    
- Implements token masking in console logs for security
    
- **Credentials**: username: `admin`, password: `password123`
    

### 2\. Invalid Credentials

- Tests authentication failure scenarios
    
- Validates proper error handling
    
- Confirms "Bad credentials" error message
    
- Demonstrates negative testing practices
    

### 3\. Get All Bookings

- Retrieves complete list of bookings
    
- Validates response is an array
    
- Stores multiple booking IDs for testing
    
- Logs total number of bookings
    
- No authentication required
    

### 4\. Get Booking By ID

- Retrieves specific booking details
    
- Validates complete booking structure
    
- Tests date format validation (YYYY-MM-DD)
    
- Confirms data type integrity (numbers, strings, booleans)
    
- Validates nested objects (bookingdates)
    

### 5\. Create Booking

- Creates new booking with dynamic dates
    
- Generates check-in (today) and check-out (today + 7 days) automatically
    
- Requires authentication token
    
- Calculates and logs total stay duration
    
- Stores created booking ID for subsequent operations
    

### 6\. Update Booking With Auth

- Performs full booking update (PUT)
    
- Requires valid authentication token
    
- Updates check-in to today + 14 days
    
- Updates check-out to today + 21 days
    
- Validates all fields are updated correctly
    
- Confirms date changes match expectations
    

### 7\. Partial Update Booking With Auth

- Demonstrates PATCH vs PUT differences
    
- Updates only specific fields (firstname, lastname, additionalneeds)
    
- Preserves unchanged fields
    
- Uses dynamic variables for update values
    
- Requires authentication
    

### 8\. Delete Booking

- Removes booking by ID
    
- Validates successful deletion (201 status)
    
- Requires authentication token
    
- Cleans up test data
    

### 9\. Get Deleted Booking

- Verifies booking was successfully deleted
    
- Tests 404 Not Found response
    
- Demonstrates proper error handling
    
- Confirms deletion completeness
    

## Test Coverage

- ‚úÖ Authentication success and failure
    
- ‚úÖ Token validation and storage
    
- ‚úÖ Status code validation (200, 201, 404)
    
- ‚úÖ Response structure validation
    
- ‚úÖ Data type validation
    
- ‚úÖ Date format validation (regex)
    
- ‚úÖ Nested object validation
    
- ‚úÖ Security best practices (token masking)
    
- ‚úÖ Dynamic data generation
    
- ‚úÖ Date calculations
    
- ‚úÖ Authorization header implementation
    

## Workflow Dependencies

**Sequential Execution Required:**

1. **Create Token** (must run first to generate auth token)
    
2. **Create Booking** (stores booking_id for updates/deletes)
    
3. **Update Booking With Auth** (uses token and booking_id)
    
4. **Partial Update Booking With Auth** (uses token and booking_id)
    
5. **Delete Booking** (uses token and booking_id)
    
6. **Get Deleted Booking** (verifies deletion)
    

## Variables Used

| Variable | Purpose | Scope |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `base_url` | API base URL | Collection |
| `username` | Authentication username (admin) | Collection |
| `password` | Authentication password (password123) | Collection |
| `token` | Authentication token | Collection |
| `firstBookingId` | First booking ID from list | Collection |
| `seconBookingId` | Second booking ID from list | Collection |
| `booking_id` | Created booking ID | Environment |
| `checkin` | Dynamic check-in date | Request |
| `checkout` | Dynamic check-out date | Request |
| `additionalneeds` | Dynamic additional needs | Request |

## Dynamic Features

### Date Generation

- Automatically calculates check-in and check-out dates
    
- Uses ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD)
    
- Generates dates relative to today
    
- Stay duration calculation in days
    

### Token Security

- Token masking in logs (shows first 4 and last 4 characters only)
    
- Secure storage in collection variables
    
- Automatic token injection in protected requests
    

## How to Run

### Setup

1. Set collection variables:
    
    - `base_url`: `https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com`
        
    - `username`: `admin`
        
    - `password`: `password123`
        

### Execution Order

**Option 1: Full Collection Run**

1. Run entire collection using Collection Runner
    
2. Requests execute in order automatically
    
3. Token and IDs propagate through workflow
    

**Option 2: Individual Requests**

1. Run "Create Token" first
    
2. Run "Create Booking" second
    
3. Run any other requests (they will use stored token and booking_id)
    

### Newman CLI

``` bash
newman run "02-Authentication-Authorization.postman_collection.json" \
  --environment your-environment.json \
  --reporters cli,htmlextra

 ```

## Prerequisites

- Postman Desktop App or Postman Web
    
- Internet connection
    
- No API key required (public test API)
    

## Skills Showcased

- Token-based authentication implementation
    
- Secure credential handling
    
- Cookie-based authorization headers
    
- Dynamic date generation and formatting
    
- Pre-request script automation
    
- Variable chaining across requests
    
- Negative testing strategies
    
- Security best practices (token masking)
    
- Complete CRUD workflow testing
    
- Date calculations and validations
    
- Regex pattern matching
    
- Error handling and validation
    

## Security Notes

- ‚ö†Ô∏è This is a public test API with publicly known credentials
    
- ‚úÖ Token masking implemented in console logs
    
- ‚úÖ Demonstrates proper authentication flow
    
- ‚úÖ Shows secure header implementation
    
- üìù In production, never log full tokens or credentials

exec: pm.test("validate token is not empty", function(){
pm.test("set token to environment variable", function(){
